page.title: 14VILLAGE PUMP FOLK FESTIVAL
page.content: The 12th Village Pump Folk Festival was held at{Stowford Farm}from 19th to 22nd of July. 1,500 people came and camped along the banks of the River for 4 days of{Country & Western {& Folk Music}. The cost to an adult for the event was Â£15. The festival is growing annually and attracted several "stars" to this peaceful gathering ,besides many visitors from abroad. {Stowford Farm and Mill}are historically important and are mentioned in early documents. Nowadays people can park their caravans over Winter there .You can buy cream teas and visit a craft centre. Further down the river , just above a small weir, is the{Farleigh Swimming Club } consisting of changing huts and diving boards made from scaffolding . We all thought it was cleaner and warmer swimming at Bradford.
